Class FoodClass

java.lang.Object
FoodClass
public class FoodClass
extends java.lang.Object
public class Food computes the optimized solution with the foods for the user

  • Constructor Details

    • FoodClass

      public FoodClass()

  • Method Details

    • optimizeWeights

      public void optimizeWeights​(double[] volArray, double[] eArray)
      before computing, we first loop through the items inputted to 'optimizeWeights'. If any of the inputted items share the same volume, check which one has the greater enjoyment. Set the one with less enjoyment to 0 so that when computing the answer that one is skipped.
      Parameters:
      volArray - array with the volume of each item
      eArray - array with the enjoyment of each item

    • isPossible

      public boolean isPossible​(double[] volInput, double cap)
      isPossible takes the volume array and the capacity and makes sure that there is atleast 1 volume that is greater than or equal to the capacity and returns true. If there is not, the user cannot eat anything and this should return false.
      Parameters:
      volInput - array of volumes
      cap - capacity of stomach
      Returns:
      true or false

    • startLoop

      public double startLoop​(double[] vArray, double[] eArray, double capacity)
      startLoop will set the volume and enjoyment arrays inputted and calls isPossible to check if it is possible. then it will call optimize weights and start the loop. This will loop over all the elements in both arrays and finds a solution for the amt of foods starting at each index i. if the returned enjoyment temp in getSolution is greater than the current enjoyment (E) which is the last enjoyment that was calculated, set E enjoymentTemp.
      Parameters:
      vArray - volume array
      eArray - enjoyment array
      capacity - stomach capacity
      Returns:
      returns the best solution for enjoyment after the loop is over

    • getSolution

      public double getSolution​(int n, int currentIndex, double capacity)
      getSolution is a recursive method with base case if capacity=0, return enjoyment, or if the index is out of bounds return to the start index of the array. Else if volume=1 and capacity != 1, go to the next index because more can be consumed. Else, get the current volume and enjoyment and divide the volume by the capacity to find how many of those you can consume. Get the corresponding enjoyment and add it to enjoymentTemp, update the capacity left over and increment the index.
      Parameters:
      n - number of elements in the volume and enjoyment arrays
      currentIndex - current index of arrays
      capacity - current capacity left
      Returns:
      either returns the enjoyment E if there is no capacity left in the stomach or calls the method again.
